intro: Sassafridium veraguense, commonly known as the Veraguas sassafras, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots and leaves contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in humid lowland areas.
